table.name: mem
table.column: 酒吧、沙龍、雞尾酒休息室 [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: We will meet in the cocktail lounge.
Wir treffen uns in der Cocktail-Lounge.
ما در سالن کوکتل ملاقات خواهیم کرد. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Vi kommer att träffas i cocktail lounge. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
我們將在雞尾酒休息室見面。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Nos encontraremos no salão de coquetéis.

table.name: mem
table.column:
This would be used if something flipped all the way over on its own accord or seemingly on its own accord (even if there is a known cause). If it was flipped over by something else, see {yoymoH:v}. If it was tipped over but not completely flipped, see {qaw':v}.
If one flipped over in bed, one would normally say {jItach:sen@@jI-:v, tach:v}. One could say {jItach'eghmoH:sen@@jI-:v, tach:v, -'egh:v, -moH:v} if there were a particular struggle or effort involved.
One is more likely to use {tachmoH:v@@tach:v, -moH:v} than {yoymoH:v:nolink} when moving someone from a prone to a supine position (or vice versa). One is more likely to use {yoymoH:v:nolink} than {tachmoH:v:nolink} when flipping hamburgers or pancakes. Either would be fine for flipping over cards, with {yoymoH:v:nolink} implying a quicker or crisper action.

table.name: mem
table.column: This word also has the idiomatic sense of "don't move!" when given as a command, either as {yItaD:sen@@yI-:v, taD:v} (spoken to one person) or {petaD:sen@@pe-:v, taD:v} (spoken to a group of people).[2; 3] To order someone to literally freeze, the suffixes {-'egh:v} and {-moH:v} would be used: {yItaD'eghmoH:sen@@yI-:v, taD:v, -'egh:v, -moH:v} "Freeze yourself!" ("Cause yourself to be frozen!")[3]

table.name: mem
table.column: The name of an ice-covered colony planet in the Klingon Empire. Its name literally means "frozen" ({taD:v}).

table.name: mem
table.column: inleda en process, börja, sätta igång, starta
開始一個過程、啟動（程序） [AUTOTRANSLATED]

The subject of this verb is the person or thing starting the process, and the object is the process. For example: {Qu' DataghDI' 'aqtu' mellota' je tIqaw.:sen} "When you begin a mission, remember Aktuh and Melota."[2]
If the starter of the process is unknown, unclear, or indefinite, the process becomes the subject of the verb (in which case it takes no object): {taghbej mu'qaD veS:sen:nolink} "Curse-warfare has definitely begun."[3]
Instead of using the verb {tagh:v:nolink}, consider using the verb suffix {-choH:v:suff}. For example, a student who is a beginner might be described as a {ghojchoHwI'} (one who is beginning to learn) or said to be {ghojchoH} (beginning to learn).

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {tagha' pawpu' meb 'ach pumDI' Heghpu' qagh.:sen:nolink} "The guest finally arrived, but by then the gagh had died."[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: ادامه دادن، ادامه دادن، تحمل، زنده ماندن [AUTOTRANSLATED]
continuar, seguir em frente, suportar, sobreviver

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to a ship in space which has rotated its nose downwards. A rotation through a negative angle of 90 degrees would mean that the ship's nose was pointed straight down relative to its previous orientation.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This song was composed by Rich Yampell, a.k.a. {HoD Qanqor:n:name,nolink}. Note that ordinarily, a rank such as {HoD:n} follows the name in Klingon, but {HoD Qanqor:n:name,nolink} comes from a region where one's rank precedes one's name.

table.name: mem
table.column: To be or not to be.
These lines have been translated from the original Klingon by Nick Nicholas and Andrew Strader.

table.name: mem
mem
table.column: extra blade on a d'k tahg
تیغه اضافی در یک dk tahg [AUTOTRANSLATED]
額外的刀片在d k tahg上 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
lâmina extra em um d'k tahg

table.name: mem
table.column: Messertyp (mit besonders langer Klinge, fast wie ein Schwert gehandhabt)

table.name: mem
table.column: Angles are measured in {lawrI':n} (or {law:n} in more ancient times or in traditional documents).[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: Presumably, there is a place called {talar:n:place,fic,nolink}.

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {cha'pujqutmey chIm lutamlu'.} "Drained dilithium crystals are replaced."[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This appeared in {STC 104:src} as {DIvI' tamey ngo':n:nolink} "Federation Archives". A single archive record would be {ta ngo':n:nolink}.

table.name: mem
table.column:
For "light" in the sense of "brightness", for example someone's eyes being "sensitive to light", consider {wovtaHghach:n@@wov:v, -taH:v, -ghach:v} instead.[1]
A dim light would be {tamghay wovHa':n@@tamghay:n, wov:v, -Ha':v} (whereas {tamghay Hurgh:n@@tamghay:n, Hurgh:v} sounds odd).[2]
This is a reference to Tom G. Smith of Industrial Light & Magic, who oversaw visual effects production for {Star Trek II:src} and {Star Trek III:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: A reference to Tom Lehrer, who performed the song "The Elements" about the chemical elements.

table.name: mem
table.column: This word does not appear in canon, but is an obvious construction based on {tamlerQeD:n:nolink}.

table.name: mem
table.column: ett slags djur (snarlik en tjur, används om både hannar och honor)
This word was used in {ghIlghameS:n:nolink}, where {QI'tu' tangqa':n:nolink} refers to the Bull of Heaven.
The Lakota or Sioux word for "buffalo" is "tatanka".

table.name: mem
table.column:
A reference to the sound made.
The English translation of the sentence from {Star Trek Constellations:src} does not appear in the book, but in the author's annotations which was a separate document. The {'e':n:pro} was probably a mistake, but can be rationalized as a typo for {-'e':n:suff}.

▶ {yIntaH qIrq 'e' vIneH. DaSwIj bIngDaq latlhpu' vItap.:sen@@yIn:v, -taH:v, qIrq:n:name, -'e':n, vI-:v, neH:v, DaS:n, -wIj:n, bIng:n, -Daq:n, latlh:n, -pu':n, vI-:v, tap:v} "Kirk I want alive. The rest I will grind beneath my boot."[2]

▶ {yIntaH qIrq 'e' vIneH. DaSwIj bIngDaq latlhpu' vItap.:sen@@yIn:v, -taH:v, qIrq:n:name, -'e':n, vI-:v, neH:v, DaS:n, -wIj:n, bIng:n, -Daq:n, latlh:n, -pu':n, vI-:v, tap:v} "Кирка я хочу взять живым. Остальных я разотру под своим ботинком."[2]

table.name: mem
table.column:
The residents of this region greatly outnumber the residents of {Qotmagh Sep:n}.
This dialect is sort of half-way between the standard dialect and the {Qotmagh Sep:n} dialect. Speakers replace {b:sen:nolink} with {mb:sen:nolink} and {D:sen:nolink} with {ND:sen:nolink}.[1, p.22]

This word appears only in the body of {KGT:src} on p.22 and not in the glossary. It appears as {taq'ev:n:nolink} and not as {taq'ev Sep:n:nolink}, but it is implied that this is the name of a region (see {Sep:n}).

table.name: mem
table.column: This means "weird" as in bizarre, unnatural, maybe creepy.[2]
This is missing from the E-K side of {TKD:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a reference to a line from the movie "Dr. Strangelove" ({taQ:v}, {bang:n}): "A big plane like a '52... varrrooom! Its jet exhaust... frying chickens in the barnyard!"

table.name: mem
table.column: This is just a Federation Standard word with Klingon pronunciation.
Dies ist nur ein Federation Standard-Wort mit klingonischer Aussprache. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این فقط یک کلمه استاندارد فدراسیون با تلفظ کلینگون است. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta är bara ett Federation Standard-ord med Klingon-uttal. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это просто стандартное слово федерации с произношением клингона. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這只是帶有克林崗語發音的聯邦標准單詞。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Esta é apenas uma palavra padrão da Federação com a pronúncia klingon. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a kind of animal somewhat resembling a dog. It is popular as a pet, but its heart is also considered a delicacy.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: Geh und paare dich mit deinem Targ!
برو با همسرت با هدف خودت! [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Действуй, вступай в отношения со своим таргом!
Vá ser parceiro com seu targ!

table.name: mem
table.column: targhlIj yab tIn law' no'lI' Hoch yabDu' tIn puS!
Your targ has a bigger brain than all your ancestors put together!
Dein Targ hat mehr Hirn als alle deine Vorfahren zusammen!
هدف شما دارای یک مغز بزرگتر از همه اجداد شما است! [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Din targ har en större hjärna än alla dina förfäder sätta ihop! [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Ваш тарг имеет больший мозг, чем все ваши предки вместе взятые! [AUTOTRANSLATED]
你的targ比你祖先放在一起的大腦更大！ [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Seu targ tem um cérebro maior do que todos os seus antepassados ​​juntos!

table.name: mem
table.column: The Tasman Sea separates Australia from New Zealand, and is colloquially called "the Ditch".

table.name: mem
table.column: This verb means to return something somewhere, for example a weapon to the weapons rack. To express the concept of returning to a place, use {chegh:v}.[1]
▶ {raSDaq jengva' vItatlh.:sen:nolink} "I return the plate to the table."[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: Though not common, the verb {tatlh:v} can be used with the suffix {-'egh:v} to convey a meaning similar to {chegh:v}. The {tatlh'egh:v:nolink} form seems to suggest that the doer of the action is forcing himself/herself to do something, perhaps because it is difficult or not desirable.
▶ {pa'Daq jItatlh'egh.:sen:nolink} "I return to the room." The implication here is that it is difficult or not desirable to return to the room.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is what someone might do to wake somebody up, or what one might do to a drink or a limb. What freezing temperatures may do to someone is {jelmoH:v@@jel:v, -moH:v}, not {tav:v:nolink}.
Das ist was man macht, um jemanden zu wecken, oder was man mit einem Getränk macht. Was kalte Temperaturen mit einem machen, ist {jelmoH:v@@jel:v, -moH:v}, nicht {tav:v:nolink}.

table.name: mem
table.column: дорога, улица, путь и т. д. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This is the physical counterpart of {He:n}.
A reference to the Tao (道), obviously.

table.name: mem
table.column: Klingon counterpart (more or less) of the "best man" at a wedding. This is normally translated as "sword-bearer", but etymologically that's not quite right. It's a frozen and somewhat modified form of an old word which was apparently something like {taywI'yan:n:nolink}, having something to do with ceremony or ritual {tay:n:2} and sword {yan:n}, but the details of the old grammatical construction are unknown.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: To be even more emphatic, one could say {tawleHnu' pogh:n:nolink}.
Maltz didn't know how gloves are involved or if there is a word which just happens to be a homophone of {pogh:n} that he didn't remember.

table.name: mem
table.column: This word might be used to refer to a fossil embedded into a stone. It is not used when referring to foreheads.
Dieses Wort könnte verwendet werden, um sich auf ein Fossil zu beziehen, das in einen Stein eingebettet ist. Es wird nicht verwendet, wenn es sich um Stirn handelt. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این کلمه ممکن است برای اشاره به فسیل تعبیه شده در یک سنگ به کار رود. در هنگام مراجعه به پیشانی استفاده نمی شود. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta ord kan användas för att hänvisa till en fossil inbäddad i en sten. Det används inte när det hänvisas till pannor. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это слово может быть использовано для обозначения ископаемого в камне. Он не используется при обращении к лбу. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這個詞可能用來指嵌入石頭的化石。指額頭時不使用它。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Essa palavra pode ser usada para se referir a um fóssil incorporado em uma pedra. Não é utilizado quando se refere a testas. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: Klingons apparently consider a people to be civilized if they have rituals (see {tay:n:2}).

table.name: mem
table.column: This is something that "tie"s a community together. Also, the procedure of putting on a neck"tie" is a kind of ritual.

table.name: mem
table.column: From lowest to highest, these ranks are: {tay:n:3,nolink}, {Sutay:n}, {veStay:n}, {Santay:n}, {'Iptay:n}.
This is a rank from John M. Ford's 1984 novel "The Final Reflection". These ranks are used by many Klingon fan clubs, despite not appearing in canon (i.e., in any TV episode or movie).

table.name: mem
table.column: This word seems to be composed of {tay:n:2} or {tay:v} and {qeq:n} or {qeq:v}. Perhaps this is an indication of what Klingons consider important to a civilisation.

table.name: mem
table.column: This verb is also used to specify membership in a Klingon House (see explanation under {tuq:n}).

table.name: mem
table.column: A planet in the Klingon Empire, where the induction into the Order of the Bat'leth takes place.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: Blut und Wasser vermischen sich nicht.
خون و آب مخلوط نمی شوند. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Sangue e água não se misturam.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is short for {ta' tlhIngan Hol:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the standard dialect of Klingon. It is also called {ta' Hol:n} for short.

table.name: mem
table.column: 偉大的事蹟，偉大的歌曲。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This verb may be used for filling a hole ({QemjIq:n}), but not for merely stopping up an opening ({qung:n}), which would be {qorgh:v}.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: food server in a Dok'e (fast-food restaurant)
سرور غذا در Dok'e (رستوران فست فود) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
food server in a Dok'e (fast-food restaurant) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
servidor de comida em um Dok'e (restaurante de comida rápida)

table.name: mem
table.column: The computer programming control flow concepts "if" and "while" were translated as {teHchugh:sen:nolink} and {teHtaHvIS:sen:nolink}, respectively, in Klingon Blockly. Setting a boolean variable to "true" was translated as {teHmoH:sen:nolink}, while setting one to "false" was translated as {teHbe'moH:sen:nolink}.[4]

table.name: mem
table.column: Generally, for every {QeD:n} there is a corresponding {tej:n:nolink}.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column:
This is missing from the E-K side of {TKD:src}.
This word takes the suffix {-Du':n:suff} when it refers to a body part, and {-mey:n:suff} otherwise.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the home planet of a founding member of the United Federation of Planets ({yuQjIjDIvI':n}).

table.name: mem
table.column: This star system is located near the Federation-Klingon border, and contains the two planets {Doy'yuS:n} and {'elaS:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This means "contradict, disavow, claim as false" and the like. It does not mean "refuse, reject, turn down, don't permit".[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: gå ombord, ge sig in på

table.name: mem
table.column: The child of a {tennuS:n:nolink} is a {tey':n:1}.
This is a reference to "Uncle Tenoose" from the Danny Thomas Show.

table.name: mem
table.column: 叔叔（父親的姐姐的丈夫） [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is used only for numbered pages in a book or something similar.
Dies wird nur für nummerierte Seiten in einem Buch oder ähnlichem verwendet. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این فقط برای صفحات شماره گذاری شده در یک کتاب یا چیز مشابه استفاده می شود. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta används endast för numrerade sidor i en bok eller något liknande. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это используется только для пронумерованных страниц в книге или что-то подобное. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這僅用於書中編號頁或類似內容。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Isso é usado apenas para páginas numeradas em um livro ou algo semelhante. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: حمل و نقل محموله، آسانسور بار [AUTOTRANSLATED]
貨物運輸船、貨物升降機 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
transportador de carga, elevador de carga
In the {BoP:src} poster, this is a type of crane.

table.name: mem
table.column: For the removal of something from the interior, consider {lel:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column:
This is the name of the Human Homeworld. For "earth" in the sense of "dirt", see {lam:n}.
Earth is a major planet in the Federation ({DIvI':n}) and the third planet in the {Sol:n} star system. The continents of Earth are: ▶ {'amerI'qa' tIng chan tIng:n} "South America" ▶ {'amerI'qa' 'ev chan 'ev:n} "North America" ▶ {'antartIq:n} "Antarctica" ▶ {'aSralya':n} "Australia" ▶ {'aSya':n} "Asia" ▶ {'avrI'qa':n} "Africa" ▶ {'ewrop:n} "Europe"

table.name: mem
table.column:
There is an idiom, {Hoj; tera'ngan rur@@Hoj:v, tera'ngan:n, rur:v}.
Note that a human ({Human:n}) is a member of the major indigenous language-capable species of Earth ({tera':n:place}), whereas Terran ({tera'ngan:n:nolink}) refers to any inhabitant of the planet.

table.name: mem
table.column: If the context is clear, this may be shortened to {nagh DIr charwI':n:nolink}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is what Klingons would call the Terran fruit.
So würden Klingonen die terranische Frucht nennen. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این چیزی است که کلینگون ها آن را تران می نامند. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta är vad Klingons skulle kalla Terranfrukten. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это то, что клингоны назвали бы фруктами терранов. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這就是克林崗人所說的人族水果。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Isto é o que os klingons chamariam de fruto terráqueo. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is what Klingons would call the Terran fruit.
So würden Klingonen die terranische Frucht nennen. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این چیزی است که کلینگون ها آن را تران می نامند. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta är vad Klingons skulle kalla Terranfrukten. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это то, что клингоны назвали бы фруктами терранов. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這就是克林崗人所說的人族水果。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Isto é o que os klingons chamariam de fruto terráqueo. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is what Klingons would call the Terran fruit.
So würden Klingonen die terranische Frucht nennen. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این چیزی است که کلینگون ها آن را تران می نامند. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta är vad Klingons skulle kalla Terranfrukten. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это то, что клингоны назвали бы фруктами терранов. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這就是克林崗人所說的人族水果。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Isto é o que os klingons chamariam de fruto terráqueo. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is what Klingons would call the Terran fruit.
So würden Klingonen die terranische Frucht nennen. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این چیزی است که کلینگون ها آن را تران می نامند. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta är vad Klingons skulle kalla Terranfrukten. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это то, что клингоны назвали бы фруктами терранов. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這就是克林崗人所說的人族水果。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Isto é o que os klingons chamariam de fruto terráqueo. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: dia da terra, hora da terra

This term is used in the invitation to {Star Trek The Exhibition:src}. The invitation reads: ▶ {tera' poH jaj wa', jar wa', jaj loSDIch, DIS wa'-Hut-Hut-chorgh. HovpoHvetlh latlh nab yIHutlh.:sen:nolink} "Save this Stardate: Sunday, January 4, 1998".[1]
Based on the information on the invitation, when telling an Earth date: ▶ the days of the week are mapped to their Klingon analogues (see under {Hogh:n}); ▶ {jar:n} followed by a number labels the month, starting with January, {jar wa':n:nolink}; ▶ the day of the month is given as an ordinal, {jaj loSDIch:n:nolink} "the fourth day"; ▶ the year is specified by giving its digits after the word {DIS:n:2}.[1]
The Terran months are: ▶ {jar wa':n:nolink} "January" ▶ {jar cha':n:nolink} "February" ▶ {jar wej:n:nolink} "March" ▶ {jar loS:n:nolink} "April" ▶ {jar vagh:n:nolink} "May" ▶ {jar jav:n:nolink} "June" ▶ {jar Soch:n:nolink} "July" ▶ {jar chorgh:n:nolink} "August" ▶ {jar Hut:n:nolink} "September" ▶ {jar wa'maH:n:nolink} "October" ▶ {jar wa'maH wa':n:nolink} "November" ▶ {jar wa'maH cha':n:nolink} "December"
Terran date, Terran time, January, February, March, April, May, June, July, August, September, October, November, December

table.name: mem
table.column: This is what Klingons would call the Terran fungus.
Dies ist, was Klingonen den terranischen Pilz nennen würden. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این چیزی است که کلینگون ها قارچ Terran می نامند. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta är vad Klingons skulle kalla Terran-svampen. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это то, что клингоны называют грибом терранов. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這就是克林崗人所說的人族真菌。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Isso é o que os klingons chamariam de fungo terráqueo. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to the Terran plant.
Dies bezieht sich auf die terranische Pflanze. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این به گیاه تران اشاره دارد. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Isso se refere à planta terráquea. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to the organ of hearing inside the head, while {qogh:n:2,body} refers to the external flap of skin, cartilage, etc.

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to a piece used in a game (such as Scrabble) or a puzzle.
Dies bezieht sich auf ein Teil, das in einem Spiel (z. B. Scrabble) oder einem Puzzle verwendet wird. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این مربوط به قطعه ای است که در یک بازی استفاده می شود (مانند Scrabble) یا یک معما. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta avser ett stycke som används i ett spel (som Scrabble) eller ett pussel. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это относится к части, используемой в игре (например, Эрудит) или головоломки. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這是指在遊戲（例如拼字遊戲）或拼圖中使用的棋子。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Refere-se a uma peça usada em um jogo (como Scrabble) ou um quebra-cabeça. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: The object is the thing which is melted.
Das Objekt ist das, was geschmolzen ist. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
جسم چیزی است که ذوب می شود. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Объект - это та вещь, которая плавится. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
O objeto é a coisa que é derretida. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This word can be used for anything rolled up like a scroll, and has also commonly come to denote any kind of list, while {Qumran:n} refers to a more ceremonial kind of scroll.[3]

The Klingon phrase as printed on the {BoP:src} poster contains typos.
This word was used for the "list" variable type in Klingon Blockly.[4]

table.name: mem
table.column: roll (down a hill like a log)
rollen, runterrollen (wie ein Baumstamm auf einem Hang)
rulla (nerför en kulle som en stock) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
rolar (descendo uma colina como um tronco)
Though this verb is related to the noun {tetlh:n}, it is not used for scrolls (unless a scroll happens to be rolling down a hill).

table.name: mem
table.column: Aside from its literal meaning, this can also be used for the sense of being close or not having wiggle room or leeway in a situation. See {tey:v:2}.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: be uncomfortable, be close, not have wiggle room or leeway
eng, unbequem, unsicher, ohne Spielraum sein
ناراحت کننده باشد، نزدیک باشد، اتاق و یا آرام نباشد [AUTOTRANSLATED]
vara obekväma, var nära, inte ha vinkla rum eller utrymme [AUTOTRANSLATED]
be uncomfortable, be close, not have wiggle room or leeway [AUTOTRANSLATED]
不舒服、靠近、沒有擺動的空間或餘地 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
ser desconfortável, estar perto, não ter espaço de manobra ou margem de manobra
▶ {tey yay:sen:@@tey:v:2, yay:n:2h} (this describes something which was just barely a victory or a last-minute victory, or something like that)

table.name: mem
table.column: be comfortable, be not close, have wiggle room or leeway
weit, bequem, sicher, mit Spielraum sein
راحت باشید، نزدیک نباشید، اتاق را لرزاند یا آرام باشید [AUTOTRANSLATED]
var bekväm, var inte nära, vinkla rum eller utrymme [AUTOTRANSLATED]
be comfortable, be not close, have wiggle room or leeway [AUTOTRANSLATED]
要舒服、不要靠近、有擺動的空間或迴旋餘地 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
ser confortável, não estar perto, ter espaço de manobra ou margem de manobra
▶ {teybe' yay:sen@@teybe':v, yay:n:2h} "the victory didn't scrape", "the victory was comfortable"

table.name: mem
table.column: This means "file" in the sense of a nail file and the like, not a data file (for which see {ta:n}).
This is defined as "file" in {KGT:src}. The "tool" part was added for clarification.

table.name: mem
table.column: kusin (fars brors ({tennuS:n}s) barn eller mors systers ({me':n}s) barn)
This word refers to one's mother's sister's child or one's father's brother's child (i.e., "parallel cousins").
Dieses Wort bezieht sich auf das Kind der Schwester einer Mutter oder das Kind des Bruders eines Vaters (d. H. "Parallele Cousins"). [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این کلمه مربوط به فرزند خواهر مادر یا فرزند برادر پدر یکی است (یعنی "پسر عموی موازی"). [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta ord hänvisar till mammas systerbarn eller ens fars brors barn (dvs "parallella kusiner"). [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это слово относится к ребенку сестры матери или ребенку брата отца (т. Е. «Параллельные двоюродные братья»). [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這個詞是指一個人的母親的妹妹的孩子或一個人的父親的兄弟的孩子（即“表親”）。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Esta palavra refere-se ao filho da irmã da mãe ou ao filho do irmão do pai (ou seja, "primos paralelos"). [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: brorsbarn (en mans brors barn), systerbarn (en kvinnas systers barn)
For a man, this word refers to the child of his brother. For a woman, it refers to the child of her sister.
Für einen Mann bezieht sich dieses Wort auf das Kind seines Bruders. Für eine Frau bezieht es sich auf das Kind ihrer Schwester. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
برای یک مرد ، این کلمه به فرزند برادرش اشاره دارد. برای یک زن ، این به فرزند خواهرش اشاره دارد. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
För en man hänvisar detta ord till sin brors barn. För en kvinna hänvisar det till hennes systers barn. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Для мужчины это слово относится к ребенку его брата. Для женщины это относится к ребенку ее сестры. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
對於一個男人來說，這個詞是指他兄弟的孩子。對於一個女人，它指的是她姐姐的孩子。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Para um homem, essa palavra se refere ao filho de seu irmão. Para uma mulher, refere-se ao filho de sua irmã. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: kvinnlig kusin (fars brors dotter eller mors systers dotter),
A female {tey':n:0}, that is, a cousin who is one's mother's sister's child or one's father's brother's child, or a niece in the sense of a man's brother's daughter or a woman's sister's daughter.

table.name: mem
table.column: manlig kusin (fars brors son eller mors systers son), brorson (en mans brors son), systerson (en kvinnas systers son)
A male {tey':n:0}, that is, a cousin who is one's mother's sister's son or one's father's brother's son, or nephew in the sense of a man's brother's son or a woman's sister's son.

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {tlhIngan tIgh DaHaDrup'a'?} (one of several inscriptions used by MO when signing books or photos) ▶ {tlhIngan tIgh - SuvwI' DevmeH paq@@tlhIngan:n, tIgh:n, SuvwI':n, DevmeH paq:n} "The Klingon Way - A Warrior's Guide"[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: There is an idiom {Dogh; tIghla' rur:sen@@Dogh:v, tIghla':n, rur:v}.[1, p.127]

table.name: mem
table.column: This word refers to any energy beam. It is an extension of the traditional meaning of {tIH:n:2} (spear shaft) to modern weaponry.[2, p.65]

table.name: mem
table.column: This word has been adapted for modern weaponry; see {tIH:n:1} (energy beam). It's also used to talk about railroads, for which see {tIHmey:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: It's not clear whether a singular {tIH:n:nolink} would refer to a single rail (i.e., half a track), a single section of track, or something else.

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {nuqDaq lupwI' mIr vItIj?@@nuqDaq:ques, lupwI' mIr:n, vI-:v, tIj:v} "Where is the train station?"[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: A "tin" is a box used to hold "match"es.

table.name: mem
table.column: area southwestward, area towards the southwest
منطقه جنوب غربی، منطقه به سمت جنوب غربی [AUTOTRANSLATED]
площадь к юго-западу, площадь к юго-западу [AUTOTRANSLATED]
área sudoeste, área em direção sudoeste
This is approximately 220 degrees on a Terran compass, if north is 0 and degrees are counted clockwise.
Dies sind ungefähr 220 Grad auf einem terranischen Kompass, wenn Nord 0 ist und Grad im Uhrzeigersinn gezählt werden. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
اگر شمالی 0 باشد و درجه در جهت عقربه ساعت شمارش شود ، این تقریباً 220 درجه در قطب نما Terran است. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta är ungefär 220 grader på en Terran kompass, om norr är 0 och grader räknas medsols. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это примерно 220 градусов на терранском компасе, если север равен 0 и градусы отсчитываются по часовой стрелке. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
如果north為0且順時針計數度數，則在Terran羅盤中約為220度。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Isso é aproximadamente 220 graus em uma bússola terráquea, se o norte for 0 e os graus forem contados no sentido horário. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: all around, all over the place
por todo lado, em todo o lugar
▶ {tIngvo' 'evDaq chanDaq jIlengpu'.:sen:nolink} "I've traveled all over the place."[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: غرب، منطقه به سمت غرب است [AUTOTRANSLATED]
oeste, área em direção ao oeste

This is the midway point between the cardinal directions {tIng:n} and {'ev:n}. It is also referred to as {'ev tIng:n:nolink} with about the same frequency.[1] It is 270 degrees on a Terran compass, if north is 0 and degrees are counted clockwise.

table.name: mem
table.column: "Tippecanoe and Tyler Too". Ash Tyler is a character in {Star Trek Discovery:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: vara lång, vara långsträckt (om ett föremål)

table.name: mem
table.column: قلب (همچنین به صورت نمادین استفاده می شود) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
The verb used for "beat" (as in a heartbeat) is {joq:v}.
Tick tock, the sound of a heart beat. The heart is also colloquially called the "ticker".

table.name: mem
table.column: Real power is in the heart.
Die wahre Kraft liegt im Herzen.
O verdadeiro poder está no coração

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to a type of Terran food.
Dies bezieht sich auf eine Art terranisches Essen. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این به نوعی غذای تران اشاره دارد. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta avser en typ av Terran-mat. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это относится к типу еды терранов. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這是指人族食物的一種。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Isso se refere a um tipo de comida terráquea. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: Hit them hard and hit them fast.
آنها را به سختی ببندند و سریع به آنها ضربه بزنند. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Slå dem hårt och slå dem snabbt. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Ударь их сильно и удари их быстро. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
用力擊打它們并快速擊中它們。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: An edged weapon, similar to an Earth longsword.
Eine scharfe Waffe, ähnlich einem Langschwert der Erde. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
سلاحی لبه دار ، شبیه کلمه کلیدی Earth. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Ett kantigt vapen, liknande ett jords longsword. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Острое оружие, похожее на длинный меч Земли. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
一種有刃武器，類似於地球長劍。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Uma arma afiada, semelhante a uma espada longa da Terra. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: شما باید قلب خود را نشان دهید [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Você precisa mostrar o seu coração

table.name: mem
table.column: The tknag is a dangerous carnivore native to the Klingon planet Taganika.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: en slags mat, tknag-hovar, (refereras alltid till i plural)
As a food item, they are always referred to in the plural.
Als Lebensmittel werden sie immer im Plural bezeichnet. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
به عنوان یک ماده غذایی ، همیشه به آنها در جمع گفته می شود. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Som livsmedel hänvisas de alltid till i plural. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Как элемент питания, они всегда упоминаются во множественном числе. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
作為食品，它們總是以復數形式提及。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Como item alimentar, eles são sempre referidos no plural. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column:
T'Kuvma was proclaimed to be "T'Kuvma the Unforgettable" ({tIquvma lIjlaHbe'bogh vay':sen:nolink}) by his followers, in an allusion to Kahless the Unforgettable (see {qeylIS'e' lIjlaHbe'bogh vay':n:name}).
His supporters include {lIr'el:n:name} and {voq:n:name}. His flagship is a sarcophagus ship covered in coffins (see {nebeylI':n}, {nev'aQ:n}, {pel'aQ:n:2}).

table.name: mem
table.column: I must show you my heart.
Ich muss euch mein Herz zeigen.
من باید قلبم را نشان دهم [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Jag måste visa dig mitt hjärta. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Мне надо вам покозать свою сердцу.
我必須向你展示出我的心。
Eu devo te mostrar meu coração.

table.name: mem
table.column: alt, antik, aus alter Zeit sein
This verb is also used for equilateral triangles (see {ra'Duch tIQ:n}).

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to the physical piece of dried bread, and not to the exclamations made while drinking.
Dies bezieht sich auf das physische Stück getrocknetes Brot und nicht auf die Ausrufe, die beim Trinken gemacht werden. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این مربوط به قطعه بدنی نان خشک شده است و نه بهانه هایی که هنگام نوشیدن انجام می شود. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta avser den fysiska biten av torkat bröd och inte till de utropen som gjordes när man dricker. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это относится к физическому куску сушеного хлеба, а не к восклицаниям, сделанным во время питья. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這是指乾麵包的實際一塊，而不是指喝酒時的驚嘆號。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Refere-se ao pedaço físico de pão seco, e não às exclamações feitas ao beber. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: be arranged in a stack, be superimposed
در یک پشته قرار بگیرد ، سوار شود [AUTOTRANSLATED]
vara anordnade i en bunt, överlagras [AUTOTRANSLATED]
ser dispostos em uma pilha, ser sobrepostos
"Superimpose A and B" is {A B je tIrmoHchu':sen:nolink}. One way to say "superimpose A on(to) B" is {B-Daq A lanchu':sen:nolink} (see {lan:v}).

"Tier".
In the printed booklet for {qep'a' 26 (2019):src}, there was a typo and {lanchu':sen:nolink} was incorrectly written as {lalchu':sen:nolink}.

table.name: mem
table.column: njuta av, roa sig, ha roligt, tycka om

For verbs used to express the enjoyment of food or music among Klingons, see {DuQ:v:2} and {'ey:v}.[2]
Klingons do not typically speak about music in terms of enjoyment, but rather in terms of what it does to the listener. For example, music might be said to {jaqmoH:v}, {SeymoH:v}, {tungHa':v}, or {pIlmoH:v}.[2]
This verb can be used reflexively to mean "enjoy oneself", "have a good time".[3; 4]

▶ {petIv'egh. qara'qu'.:sen@@pe-:v, tIv:v, -'egh:v, qa-:v, ra':v:1, -qu':v} "Enjoy yourselves. That's an order."[3] ▶ {SutIv'egh'a'?:sen@@Su-:v, tIv:v, -'egh:v, -'a':v} "You will enjoy yourselves?"[4]
[1] {TKD:src}, [2] {KGT:src}, [3] {Star Trek V:src}, [4] {"A Klingon Christmas Carol" trailer:src}

table.name: mem
table.column: It is stated that this cannot take an object.
[1] {Saarbrücken qepHom'a' 2017:src}, [2] {DSC - The Butcher's Knife Cares Not for the Lamb's Cry:src}

table.name: mem
table.column: Unlike {rach:v}, this verb is not typically applied to beings, and it suggests only restoration to a previous state (and not necessarily improvement).[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: There is an idiom, {bIt; tI'qa' vIghro' rur@@bIt:v, tI'qa' vIghro':n, rur:v}.
{bIt:v:nolink} is actually written incorrectly as {tIb:v:nolink} on {KGT p.132:src}, in the statement of the idiom.

table.name: mem
table.column: slutgiltigt pröva, testa (på ett avgörande sätt), bevisa

This word appears in a deleted line from {Star Trek V:src}: {logh veQDaq bachchugh, yoH 'e' toblaHbe' SuvwI'.@@logh:n, veQ:n, -Daq:n, bach:v, -chugh:v, yoH:v, 'e':n, tob:v, -laH:v, -be':v, SuvwI':n} "Shooting space garbage is no test of a warrior's mettle." This line was changed to {vaj toDuj Daj ngeHbej DI vI'.:sen} (while maintaining the original English subtitle) in the process of editing.

table.name: mem
table.column: For courage of a surprising or unexpected kind, see {qajunpaQ:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: A beard is a symbol of courage.
Ein Bart ist ein Symbol des Mutes.
Ett skägg är en symbol för mod. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
A barba é um símbolo de coragem.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is roughly like the English "Aha!" ({TKD 5.5:src})

table.name: mem
table.column: If the deception involves honor or social status, see {Qaq:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: In {STC 104:src} this was given as the plural {tojbogh pa' tuHmey:n:nolink} "Holodeck Adventures".

table.name: mem
table.column: go through, pass through, pass among
عبور کنید ، عبور کنید ، عبور کنید [AUTOTRANSLATED]
go through, pass through, pass among [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This is used for traveling through an undifferentiated mass or collection of objects using the space between them (a forest, a crowd, water, soil, space).

Dies wird verwendet, um durch eine undifferenzierte Masse oder Sammlung von Objekten zu reisen, wobei der Raum zwischen ihnen (ein Wald, eine Menge, Wasser, Boden, Raum) verwendet wird. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این مورد برای مسافرت از طریق توده ای بی نظیر یا مجموعه ای از اشیاء با استفاده از فضای بین آنها (یک جنگل ، جمعیت ، آب ، خاک ، فضا) استفاده می شود. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta används för att resa genom en odifferentierad massa eller samling av föremål med utrymmet mellan dem (en skog, en folkmassa, vatten, jord, utrymme). [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это используется для путешествий через недифференцированную массу или коллекцию объектов, используя пространство между ними (лес, толпа, вода, почва, пространство). [AUTOTRANSLATED]
它用於穿越未分化的物體或使用它們之間的空間（森林，人群，水，土壤，空間）收集物體。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
É usado para viajar através de uma massa indiferenciada ou coleção de objetos usando o espaço entre eles (uma floresta, uma multidão, água, solo, espaço). [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This can be used for a head movement.
Dies kann für eine Kopfbewegung verwendet werden. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این می تواند برای حرکت سر استفاده شود. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta kan användas för en huvudrörelse. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это может быть использовано для движения головы. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Isso pode ser usado para um movimento da cabeça. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
It is explicitly stated that this verb is intransitive, and that {tommoH:v@@tom:v, -moH:v} is used for the subject tilting the object.

table.name: mem
table.column:
This refers to a single technique executed in a fight or, by extension, a single maneuver played in a game.[3]
It is also used to name martial arts stances. To command someone to strike a stance or pose, the verb {much:v:3} is used. The word {tonSaw':n:nolink} may be left out of the name if the context is clear.[4]
To translate "The Final Reflection", where "reflection" is a maneuver in a game (see {tlhInja:n}), Maltz suggested {tonSaw' Qav:n:nolink} or {neSlo' tonSaw' Qav:n:nolink}.[3]
move, maneuver, manoeuvre, manoeuver, stance, pose

table.name: mem
table.column: Tom Terrific is a cartoon character who wears a funnel-shaped "thinking cap".

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a rare mineral which is mined.
Dies ist ein seltenes Mineral, das abgebaut wird. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این ماده معدنی نادر است که استخراج می شود. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta är ett sällsynt mineral som bryts. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這是一種稀有的礦物質。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Este é um mineral raro que é extraído. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: There is an idiom, {tlhIb; toppa' rur}.

table.name: mem
table.column: Its small eggs are eaten whole, shell and all, by the handful.[1, p.88]

table.name: mem
table.column:
This refers to a tool or device, and not a postage stamp (for which see {HIjmeH chaw':n}).
To use such a stamp, one must first ink it up ({laS:v}) with an ink pad ({rItlh 'echlet:n}), then slam it down ({Dut:v}). The resulting image is called a {yang:n}.
▶ {toqwIn vIDut@@toqwIn:n, vI-:v, Dut:v} "I slam down the stamp."

table.name: mem
table.column: type of animal, similar to Terran bird of prey
نوع حیوان مانند شکار پرنده Terran [AUTOTRANSLATED]
тип животного, похожий на терранскую хищную птицу [AUTOTRANSLATED]
動物的類型、類似於人族的猛禽 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
tipo de animal, semelhante à ave de rapina terráquea

table.name: mem
table.column: This verb describes the action of a person or animal. It can also be applied to aircraft, for which see {tor:v:2}.

table.name: mem
table.column: pitch (aircraft tilts nose up or down)
sich neigen (Spitze des Flugzeugs geht nach oben oder nach unten)
زمین (هواپیما به بالا یا پایین بینی) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
vara tippande, vara vippande (flygmaskin rör nosen upp eller ner)
pitch (aircraft tilts nose up or down) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
俯仰（飛機向上或向下傾斜） [AUTOTRANSLATED]
arremesso (a aeronave inclina o nariz para cima ou para baixo)

This is just the verb {tor:v:1} applied to aircraft.
Pitching downwards is indicated using a negative angle (see {taH:v:2}).
The eleva"tor"s control the pitch on an airplane.

table.name: mem
table.column: Tor Books is a publisher of speculative (see {SIv:v}) fiction.

table.name: mem
table.column: Based on its usage in the {paq'batlh:src}, the thing being climbed is the object, the destination is marked with {-Daq:n}, and the starting point is marked with {-vo':n}.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: aparelhos de escalada, ginásio na selva

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to a moment of clarity between two warriors on the field of battle.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: قبول این پاها را بهم بزنید [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Aceite estas pernas recheadas de to'baj.

table.name: mem
table.column: [1] {DSC - Si Vis Pacem, Para Bellum:src}, [2] {Saarbrücken qepHom'a' 2019:src}

table.name: mem
table.column: to take some time to consider a matter
برای اتخاذ یک موضوع وقت بگذارید [AUTOTRANSLATED]
att ta lite tid att överväga en fråga [AUTOTRANSLATED]
to take some time to consider a matter [AUTOTRANSLATED]
levar algum tempo para considerar um assunto
This idiomatic expression literally means "to chew ligament".
Dieser idiomatische Ausdruck bedeutet wörtlich "Band kauen". [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این اصطلاح اصطلاحاً به معنای واقعی کلمه به معنای "جویدن رباط" است. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta idiomatiska uttryck betyder bokstavligen "att tugga ligament". [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это идиоматическое выражение буквально означает «жевать связку». [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這種慣用語的字面意思是“咀嚼韌帶”。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Essa expressão idiomática significa literalmente "mastigar ligamento". [AUTOTRANSLATED]

▶ {to'waQ yIyIv.:sen:nolink} "Take your time thinking about it." ▶ {to'waQ vIyIvtaH.:sen:nolink} "I'm in the process of taking my time considering the matter." ▶ {to'waQ yIyIvQo', DaH yIwuq!:sen:nolink} "Don't chew ligament, decide now!"

table.name: mem
table.column: In comparison, {'op pIq:n@@'op:n, pIq:n} means "at some point in the future".

In {Star Trek VI:src}, Chancellor Gorkon makes a toast to "the undiscovered country... the future". The phrase "The Undiscovered Country" (TUC) comes from Hamlet's soliloquy and is also the name of the film.

table.name: mem
table.column: to prophesize, see the future, know the future
برای پیشگویی، دیدن آینده، آگاهی از آینده [AUTOTRANSLATED]
att profetera, se framtiden, känna framtiden [AUTOTRANSLATED]
para profetizar, ver o futuro, conhecer o futuro
For Klingons, to prophesize is to be able to "summon" the future somehow.
Prophezeiung bedeutet für Klingonen, die Zukunft irgendwie "beschwören" zu können. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
برای کلینگون ، پیشگویی این است که بتوانیم آینده را به نوعی "احضار" کنیم. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
För Klingons är att förutsäga att på något sätt kunna "kalla" framtiden. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Для клингонов пророчество - это как-то «вызвать» будущее. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
對於克林崗人而言，預言就是能夠以某種方式“召喚”未來。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Para os klingons, profetizar é ser capaz de "convocar" o futuro de alguma forma. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
In {TOS - Mirror, Mirror:src}, Mirror Spock says to Kirk: "One man cannot summon the future."

table.name: mem
table.column: This could also be shortened to {rItwI':n:nolink} if the context is clear.

table.name: mem
table.column: This word is listed among other militaristic terminology in the body of {KGT:src} on p.48.

table.name: mem
mem
table.column: A warrior's blood boils before the fire is hot.
Das Blut des Kriegers kocht, bevor das Feuer heiß ist.
خون جنگجو قبل از آتش سوزی داغ می شود [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Krigarens blod kokar innan elden är varm. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Кровь воина кипит, пока огонь не остыл. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
在火炎熱之前，戰士的血液沸騰了。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
O sangue de um guerreiro ferve antes que o fogo esteja quente.

table.column: موتور بیش از حد گرم است [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This verb can take {'e':n:pro} as its object.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This can be applied to music.[2, p.71]

table.name: mem
table.column: Tung-Yen Lin was a pioneer in standardising the use of prestressed concrete.

table.name: mem
table.column:
To say "Kahlor of the House of Molor", one simply says {qeylor, molor tuq:sen:nolink} "Kahlor, House of Molor". To be more formal, one can add the father's name, as in {qeylor, qeylIn puqloD, molor tuq:sen:nolink} "Kahlor, son of Kahlin, (of the) House of Molor".[2]
Another formal and slightly archaic way to express membership in a House is to use the verb {tay':v}: ▶ {tay' qeylor molor tuq je:sen:nolink} "Kahlor is of the House of Molor" ▶ {matay' jIH molor tuq je:sen:nolink} "I am of the House of Molor" ▶ {Sutay' SoH molor tuq je:sen:nolink} "You are of the House of Molor" This construction seems to be related to the proverb {reH tay' ghot tuqDaj je.:sen}[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: See under {tuq:n} for an explanation of how to express membership in a House.

table.name: mem
table.column: You honor me, you all honor me.
من به شما احترام می گذارم، همه شما را به من عطا می کنند [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Du hedrar mig, alla hedrar mig. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Вы уважаете меня, вы все уважаете меня. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
你尊重我，你們都尊重我。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Você me honra, todos vocês me honram.

This phrase is used when speaking to multiple people. When speaking to one person, say {choquvmoH.:sen}
If the people you're speaking to are your superiors, consider adding {-neS:v:suff}.
You honour me, you all honour me.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a device that can read the contents of a subject's brain, which is alluded to in {TOS - Errand of Mercy:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: klä av sig, ta av sig (kläder)
See {qawmoH:v} for an example of how to use a verb like this one.
Siehe {qawmoH:v} für Beispiele, wie man dieses Verb verwenden kann.

table.name: mem
table.column: klä på sig, sätta på sig (kläder)

See {qawmoH:v} for an example of how to use a verb like this one.
The slang expression {qogh tuQmoHHa':sen}, literally "to take off one's belt", means "to not hear".[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: 執行、執行（任務）、執行（職責） [AUTOTRANSLATED]

▶ {tera' jar Soch, DIS wa' Hut jav Hut, maSDaq SaqmeH Qu' wa'DIch HochHom turlu'taHvIS, wej logh lengwI'pu' pa'mey 'oH Apollo wa'maH wa' ra'ghom bobcho' Columbia'e'.:sen:nolink} "The Apollo 11 Command Module, 'Columbia,' was the living quarters for the three-person crew during most of the first manned lunar landing mission in July 1969."[1] ▶ {Da'Irghlu'chugh, potlhqu' Huch Daghaqbogh, 'ej yInmey lutoDlu'meH Qu' 'ut wItur 'e' QaH noblIj.:sen:nolink} "If you were bullied, money that you contribute is very important, and your gift will help us carry out an essential mission so that lives are saved."[3]
[1] {Smithsonian GO FLIGHT app:src}, [2] {Saarbrücken qepHom'a' 2016:src}, [3] {Pop Culture Hero Coalition announcement:src} ({KLI mailing list 2016.11.30:src})

table.name: mem
table.column: If the context isn't clear, {De'wI' turwI':n} would be used.

table.name: mem
table.column: From Latin "micturation", maybe also a reference to the colour of tumeric.

table.name: mem
mem
table.column:
Note that this refers to the geometric figure, and not to a glass object used for refracting light.
A prism with a three-sided base is a {ra'Duch tut:n@@ra'Duch:n, tut:n:2}, and so on. A cylinder is a {gho tut:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is literally "column vehicle", and refers to the cab, not the entire system.
Dies ist wörtlich "Säulenfahrzeug" und bezieht sich auf die Kabine, nicht auf das gesamte System. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این به معنای واقعی کلمه "وسیله نقلیه ستونی" است و به کابین اشاره دارد ، نه کل سیستم. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta är bokstavligen "kolonnfordon" och avser hytten, inte hela systemet. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это буквально «колонный автомобиль» и относится к кабине, а не ко всей системе. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這實際上是“列式車輛”，是指駕駛室，而不是整個系統。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Este é literalmente "veículo de coluna" e refere-se à cabine, não a todo o sistema. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: Maltz was asked about "canon", but didn't give an answer.

table.name: mem
table.column: If you spit out liquid, then {bItuy':sen:nolink}, but if you spit out solids, then {bItlhIS:sen:nolink}.

table.name: mem
table.column: 茶杯（較舊或較高級的單詞） [AUTOTRANSLATED]
xícara de chá (palavra mais antiga ou de classe alta)
This is an upper-class word for {Dargh HIvje':n}. It's an archaic word which used to mean only metal cup.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the verb {tu':v} with the suffix {-lu':v}, the combination of which is often translated as "there is" in English.[1] Note that the third-person singular prefix is used, even if the object is plural (when one might expect the prefix {lu-:v:pref}, i.e., {lutu'lu':sen:nolink}).[1; 3; 4]

table.name: mem
table.column: "Sock it to me" was a frequent catchphrase on the sketch comedy television show "Laugh-In".

table.name: mem
table.column: This can also be used for a "theme", as applied to an app.[2]
